snippet: Thursday’s highlights from around the Web include an investigation into how content is censored on Sina Weibo, a popular Chinese social network. Plus, an argument for why the notion of unplugging doesn’t exist anymore.
abstract: Thursday’s highlights from around the Web include an investigation into how content is censored on Sina Weibo, a popular Chinese social network. Plus, an argument for why the notion of unplugging doesn’t exist anymore.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: The Futility of Unplugging, and How to Get Censored on China's Twitter
